text: The following lists events that happened during 1954 in Singapore. ==Incumbents== * Governor: Sir John Fearns Nicoll ==Events== ===February=== * 22 February - Rendel Commission's recommendations were unveiled to the public. It proposed changes to the constitution, which took effect on 8 February 1955. ===May=== * 13 May - The National Service riots took place in Singapore after a peaceful demonstration turned violent. ===August=== * 21 August - The Singapore Labour Front (LF) was founded. ===October=== * 27 October - Singapore Polytechnic was founded as the first polytechnic in Singapore. ===November=== * 21 November - The People's Action Party (PAP) was founded. ==Births== * 6 January - Ong Keng Yong, diplomat. * 9 April - Lim Hng Kiang, former politician. * 9 May - Ho Peng Kee, legal academic and former politician. * 13 July - Lim Swee Say, former politician. * 23 August - Halimah Yacob, President of Singapore. * 13 September - George Yeo, former politician. * 27 December - Teo Chee Hean, Senior Minister of Singapore. ==See also== *List of years in Singapore ==References== Singapore Category:Years in Singapore
title: 1954 in Singapore
